column2: MommaCHx3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter is 4 now and has been on it for two years. She has had constipation since birth. We just got back from week stay at children's Hospital in DC because of constipation. I now give a bottle cap full (not measure cap) 2xs a day in 1/2 apple juice 1/2 water- Seeming to work better than just in morning. Stools seem normal size now and normal consistency for a 4 yr old, they were overly large and hard, sometimes pebble like. She has been gassy on this.  She eats excellent, not a fast food child - eats veggies and fruits with no problems...but still has constipation! I was very leary of having her on this for so long, but if you don't find the right balance in doses it just gets worse, too loose or opposite! She ended up in ER due to belly enlarging and no BM or urine output. The week prior she had a high fever 103.6 due to virus - They think since she wasn't eating or drinking properly(during Virus)motility shut down. After ruling out several other potential issues she was flushed out, several fleets, eating and drinking better she stooled again on her own. Warning...She had soiled her pants at school and at home week prior - look up constipation -we thought she had loose stools but it was due to hard stool blocking the way and leakage around it - uncontrollable to her. I wish I had known it was a warning sign!!!

column2: martee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed from my xray with alot of bile in my colon. I am getting a colonoscopy in 2 weeks and was also prescribed glycolax daily and starting taking the powder once a day from Sunday thru Wednesday. I am going to check with my Dr. to see if I can take less often than "every day" because I cannot handle the side effects from this powder, although I did have a daily bile movement, I don't think its worth putting up with the other symptoms.
